intro: Amaracarpus solomonensis, commonly known as Solomon's amara, is a flowering plant native to the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
